segment.source: Configure the Workstation Authentication Certificate Template (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure the Workstation Authentication Certificate Template (Windows 10)

segment.source: Configure the Workstation Authentication Certificate Template
segment.target: Configure the Workstation Authentication Certificate Template

segment.source: Configure the Workstation Authentication Certificate Template
segment.target: Configure the Workstation Authentication Certificate Template

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: This procedure describes how to configure a certificate template that Active Directory Certification Services (AD CS) uses as the starting point for device certificates that are automatically enrolled and deployed to workstations in the domain.
segment.target: This procedure describes how to configure a certificate template that Active Directory Certification Services (AD CS) uses as the starting point for device certificates that are automatically enrolled and deployed to workstations in the domain.

segment.source: It shows how to create a copy of a template, and then configure the template according to your design requirements.
segment.target: It shows how to create a copy of a template, and then configure the template according to your design requirements.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To configure the workstation authentication certificate template and autoenrollment
segment.target: To configure the workstation authentication certificate template and autoenrollment

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of both the Domain Admins group in the root domain of your forest, and a member of the Enterprise Admins group.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of both the Domain Admins group in the root domain of your forest, and a member of the Enterprise Admins group.

segment.source: On the device where AD CS is installed, open the Certification Authority console.
segment.target: On the device where AD CS is installed, open the Certification Authority console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, right-click Certificate Templates, and then click Manage.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, right-click Certificate Templates, and then click Manage.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the Workstation Authentication template.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the Workstation Authentication template.

segment.source: On the Action menu, click Duplicate Template.
segment.target: On the Action menu, click Duplicate Template.

segment.source: In the Duplicate Template dialog box, select the template version that is appropriate for your deployment, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Duplicate Template dialog box, select the template version that is appropriate for your deployment, and then click OK.

segment.source: For the resulting certificates to have maximum compatibility with the available versions of Windows, we recommended that you select Windows Server 2003.
segment.target: For the resulting certificates to have maximum compatibility with the available versions of Windows, we recommended that you select Windows Server 2003.

segment.source: On the General tab, in Template display name, type a new name for the certificate template, such as Domain Isolation Workstation Authentication Template.
segment.target: On the General tab, in Template display name, type a new name for the certificate template, such as Domain Isolation Workstation Authentication Template.

segment.source: Click the Subject Name tab.
segment.target: Click the Subject Name tab.

segment.source: Make sure that Build from this Active Directory information is selected.
segment.target: Make sure that Build from this Active Directory information is selected.

segment.source: In Subject name format, select Fully distinguished name.
segment.target: In Subject name format, select Fully distinguished name.

segment.source: Click the Request Handling tab.
segment.target: Click the Request Handling tab.

segment.source: You must determine the best minimum key size for your environment.
segment.target: You must determine the best minimum key size for your environment.

segment.source: Large key sizes provide better security, but they can affect server performance.
segment.target: Large key sizes provide better security, but they can affect server performance.

segment.source: We recommended that you use the default setting of 2048.
segment.target: We recommended that you use the default setting of 2048.

segment.source: Click the Security tab.
segment.target: Click the Security tab.

segment.source: In Group or user names, click Domain Computers, under Allow, select Enroll and Autoenroll, and then click OK.
segment.target: In Group or user names, click Domain Computers, under Allow, select Enroll and Autoenroll, and then click OK.

segment.source: Note: If you want do not want to deploy the certificate to every device in the domain, then specify a different group or groups that contain the device accounts that you want to receive the certificate.
segment.target: Note: If you want do not want to deploy the certificate to every device in the domain, then specify a different group or groups that contain the device accounts that you want to receive the certificate.

segment.source: Close the Certificate Templates Console.
segment.target: Close the Certificate Templates Console.

segment.source: In the Certification Authority MMC snap-in, in the left pane, right-click Certificate Templates, click New, and then click Certificate Template to Issue.
segment.target: In the Certification Authority MMC snap-in, in the left pane, right-click Certificate Templates, click New, and then click Certificate Template to Issue.

segment.source: In the Enable Certificate Templates dialog box, click the name of the certificate template you just configured, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Enable Certificate Templates dialog box, click the name of the certificate template you just configured, and then click OK.
